main event: A civilian reported seeing a round, silver object the size of a dinner plate (12 inches in diameter) in the sky over Downing, Missouri on February 26, 1960.
interesting points: The object was visible for a period of 15-20 minutes.
The object seemed to start to the south and then instantaneously moved to the southeast.
The sighting was a ground visual observation with no optical aids used.
The Air Force investigator spoke to the reliable civilian observer but could not provide a logical explanation for the sighting.
The report indicates the object had no noticeable exhaust or sound.
sighted object: round, silver object the size of a dinner plate (12 inches in diameter)
